alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:07PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 613 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. This includes the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. * WHEN...Until 613 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rainfall intensity has trended down, but drainage will continue over the next hour, with flow possible over low lying roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate rainfall. Minor flooding may continue to occur over the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Bernardino, Moreno Valley, Redlands, Yucaipa, Forest Falls, Mount San Gorgonio, Highland, Colton, western Beaumont, Banning, and the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
